reviewText: You'll enjoy this workout.  It's tough.  It's simple.  It's a new take.  However, it's not Georges St. Pierre's workout program...it's Erik Owings' (the trainer) workout...Georges is just basically a prop.  Nevertheless, a doggone good workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I wanted to get into shape and not have to put myself out there in the gym.  I looked at several different options for at home workouts.  My criteria were the following; easy to follow workouts, no home equipment requirements, and realistic results.  After several weeks of this one DVD I couldn't be happier.  It matched all the criteria that I wanted (though I had to buy weights) and the workout is so simple yet challenging enough to make me feel good.  I have already begun to see results and I am eager for the other DVD's he has to offer.If you are wondering if you can do an at home workout, this is the perfect DVD to get.  You don't have to invest in the multiple and expensive DVD sets to find out if you can do it.  He has a set that I am eager to get after falling into routine with this one.  You will not be disappointed with what you get for the money.
summary: After a lot of searching and hoping, I've found the right one.

reviewText: The workout portion of the video is very good.  Georges is a bit difficult to understand at times, and he is pretty "wooden" as a spokesperson, but the workout itself is definitely demanding; even Georges is breathing heavily at times.  Really that is my only peeve with this video, but since I notice it, it detracts from my workout a bit.  I have several other DVDs that I follow more often than this one.
Title: N/A

reviewText: I thought this was boring and not too challenging. I was surprised it wasn't more difficult.  I expected to be sweating buckets.  I found it slow and almost annoying.  I think what was annoying was the trainer kept talking and fast.  I felt like he would make an excellent sales person.  John St. Pierre was not too motivating and appeared to struggle with some moves that I found not too complicated.  He was also quite negative.  The trainer kept asking him how an excercise was for him and he repeatedly said terrible.  It's not a workout dvd that I plan on using again in the near future.  Although, maybe for a change every two to three months I might toss it in the dvd player.  I will probably quickly realize why it has dust on it after a few minutes into the workout.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This workout changed my life !I have finally decided to take good care of myself, to eat well and to do more exercises. I needed something to motivate myself, I needed a "map", a good way to start. Well I have found this DVD !Being a huge GSP fan, buying this DVD was a no-brainer. I have a huge amount of respect for GSP, as a man and as an athlete. Georges should be a role model for anyone wanting to be healthy and in great shape. The man is all about self-discipline, determination, and hard work. Being 26 years old I know that it's now or never, I really need to take care or myself, and this DVD is really what I needed to motivate myself, to kick myself in the butt.This workout is broken down into five high intensity circuits designed to burn up calories. The workout focus on your chest, back, arms and legs at an elevated heart rate. You'll gain strength, lean out, and resist fatigue in less time to get the best physique of your life. The breakdown for this program is:- The Warm Up ( Under 11 minutes )- The Workout ( Under 30 minutes )- The Cool Down ( Under 7 minutes )Both the Warm Up and Cool Down are very important, you really need to do both if you want to feel great, and to prevent injuries. At first the workout is very challenging and difficult to do if, like me, you are not in great shape. However you need to be patient and to take it one step at a time. At first I thought I would never be able to do the entire workout, so I did one round at a time, at my pace, and now 1 month later I can do the entire workout in 30 minutes. It's not easy, challenging, but I already feel a lot better, and my self-esteem is already a lot better too. Like Georges say in the DVD: There's no magic pill to it, if you want to look good and lose weight you need to work hard. :)I highly recommend this DVD. It's a cliché, I know but: If I can do it YOU can do it. Believe in yourself, work hard and you'll see the results !! Merci Georges !!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This is the first time that I have worked out with Georges St. Pierre.  He is completely honest in this workout.  When asked how he is feeling, he states, "Terrible."  He goes on to say that he knows that he has to work on these things in order to be effective when he is fighting.  I appreciate that honesty.  He comes across as a real person and that is something that I appreciate especially on those days when I am struggling with a workout.

reviewText: This is a fun and very challenging workout. The program is designed in "rounds," so you go at a fast pace for a round and then get a quick rest. It's a lot of compound moves, similar to other circuit training videos out there. I really like the compound moves and find I do not get bored as easily as I would just doing squats curls (or whatever). The time goes by more quickly. I also like that the trainer in the video really explains the proper way to perform the moves and offers encouragement without going overboard. There is also a section devoted just to instruction, so if you are not familiar with certain things, you can watch the instructional part before starting the workout. I don't have the whole Rushfit series, but this DVD makes me want to order it.

reviewText: I bought this movie new, it came in a good package. I have used the DVD a few times and it is kicking my butt. I am very happy with this purchase.

reviewText: I bought this dvd just thinking that if I didn't like it, I was not going to be sorry for buying the whole series. That was a mistake. I need to buy the whole series of Rushfit. This dvd delivers.If you have already done P90X and Insanity, this workout is a very nice innovative variation. George sounds funny with his French accent, but his trainer in the video is all business and apparently very knowledgeable.In essence, this routine is just another great dvd for those who really are into strength and conditioning training. It is dynamic, innovative, and has lots of potential in terms of giving the user the ability to work with different weights and movement variations. If this is good, it is very likely that the whole Rushfit series delivers as well. I'll buy it soon.If you can already do burpees, squats, and push ups, you'll enjoy it even more!
Title: N/A

reviewText: "Georges St. Pierre Rushfit: Strength & Endurance Workout" is a fairly short and intense workout.  It is great if your time is limited, and if you want a longer workout, just repeat your favorite circuit or round.Mr. St. Pierre uses twenty pound weights.  I used 10 pound weights.  I was sweating and sore about 3 or 4 hours later.Here's the breakdown.Warm up is under 11 minutes.Workout is under 30 minutes.Cool down is under 7 minutes.**********************************************************************************The workout is made up of 5 circuits or rounds. They are called rounds because they are based on mixed martial arts fights.  Each round is about 5 minutes.  In each round, Mr. St. Pierre demonstrates along with two other people, one male and one female.  Erik Owens is the instructor.Round One (about 5 minutes) No weights are used.Air squat (60 seconds)Iso squat (60 seconds) This is really tough.Hands off push-up (60 seconds)Back Extension (60 seconds)Pop-up (60 seconds)One minute rest or stretchRound Two (about 5 minutes) No weights are used.Air squat (60 seconds)Squat thrust (60 seconds)Pop-up (60 seconds)Burpee (60 seconds)Lateral plank (60 seconds)One minute rest or stretchRound Three (about 5 and a half minutes) Weights are used.Lateral lunge (60 seconds)Rotating overhead press (30 seconds)Rotating bent row (30 seconds)Alternating up right row (30 seconds)Rotating curl (30 seconds)Lateral lunge (30 seconds)Rotating overhead press (30 seconds)Rotating bent over row (30 seconds)Alternating up right row (30 seconds)Rotating curl (30 seconds)One minute rest or stretchRound Four (about 5 minutes) Weights are used.Around the world (30 seconds)Single arm swing (30 seconds)Dumbbell high pull (30 seconds)Single arm row on one leg (30 seconds)Diagonal press (30 seconds)Repeat the above five exercises with the other arm, 30 seconds each.One minute rest or stretchRound Five (about 5 and half minutes) Weights are used.Twisting floor press (60 seconds)Twisting floor press, other side (60 seconds)Half get-up (60 seconds) I could not do these.Half get-up, other side (60 seconds)Prone alternating dumbbell row (60 seconds)**********************************************************************************There is also a tutorial called "Foundation Moves: Exercise How-To's & Dumbbell How-To's," which is about 46 and a half minutes.  I learned a few new things, especially in the dumbbell area.Here's what Mr. St. Pierre, the talent, and Mr. Owens, the instructor, cover.SquatLungePush-upSit-upBack extensionRotationCore activationBurpee and squat thrustDumbbbell instruction is listed below.DumbbellDumbbell squat (After this D. refers to the dumbbell.)D. lungeD. standing pressD. rowsD. high pulls (upright row)D. power cleanD. swingD. get-up (This is where the most detailed instruction is given by Mr. Owens.)
Title: N/A

reviewText: Like the first reviewer I found the entire series on the net and purchased it. They are all uniformly first class and look great on a widescreen monitor/television as they are 16x9 aspect ratio. Rather than repeat everything the first reviewer wrote in his near perfect recap I'll add this bit. Each DVD (I assume they will all be offered for individual sale) has the SAME warm up routine, and warm down routine..in fact its the same footage...so each workout is truly only about 40+or- minutes of new material.  Each DVD is rated at 100 minutes and that includes a series Promo, and lesson Promo...as well as a very good feature called FOUNDATIONS which is a 40 plus (my memory fades it could be longer) session where the instructor and St-Pierre demonstrate the correct form for many of the exercises used in the programs and this is also repeated on every DVD.  I think its fine to have these repeats as it makes a single purchase more valuable and doesn't cause me to think I was jipped on the entire set. For the entire set the DVDs end up being about 10 bucks each and I've really enjoyed working with them. I'm a middle aged guy in very very good shape and by the 5th cycle in each one I'm challenged to finish with correct form.
summary: I purchased the entire series and they are all terrific!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I was actually expecting this workout to be too difficult for me. I think I was maybe a little intimidated by a George St. Pierre in it, haha! Actually he isnt even the instructor for the video, but is there doing it along while giving some pointers.I imagine those in decent shape will not have to modify the moves too much, as I found I was able to keep up and I am far from top notch shape. The only thing I do differently, is use lighter weights as 10 or 15lbs are too heavy for me with so much repetition. What I like most about this workout, is my husband enjoys it also and we do it together.
Title: N/A

reviewText: First let me say that I am just an intermediate exerciser and workout to dvds or play sports about 5 times a week. I normally complete workouts from Jillian Michaels, Jessica Smith, Michelle Dozois, etc. and all of those workouts were harder than this one. For instance, I usually use 5 lb dumbells in all my other dvds, but this one was so easy that I had to use my 10 lb weights; something that I never do! I even did the pushup burpees, squats, air squats, etc. at a much faster pace than everyone so I could try and get my heart rate up more. I thought the workout was really fun though and the instructor is good and GSP is really likeable in this dvd. However, it was just too easy. I thought this workout was going to be so difficult and challenging, but I didn't hardly break a sweat and was never breathing heavy. The workout is only a total of 27 minutes and is divided into 5 rounds with breaks in between each round. One really good dvd that I recently purchased that is similar to this workout, but with more of a challenge, is Mike Donavanik's Extreme Burn. I recommend that one if you find this workout to be too easy. Also, another good workout for strength and endurance (the reason why I initially purchased this dvd) is Michelle Dozois' Peak 10 more cardio strength. Overall, this is a great workout it's just more for beginners or beginner-intermediates.
summary: Great workout, but a little too easy
Title: N/A

reviewerName: tao of ben~ "Be Water, My Friend. - Bruce Lee"
reviewText: It's not just for martial artist, fighters or weekend warriors. Everyone can benefit from this dvd. It's cool that they are selling it separate from the set. And at a great price. Viewing the "foundation" section of the dvd is key to the newbies. It is also a great review for intermediates and advanced. Don't think that if you are advance that you wouldn't benefit from this. Even the champ himself (GSP) is struggling through most of the isometric holds.After viewing the foundation section you can go work out. It's about 10 minutes of warm-up, 30 minutes+ of actual exercise with brief breaks to get the lactic acid that makes you burn calm down a bit. Then a 6 minute cool down, which is essential to any workout.GSP and his trainer Erik Owings does a great job in getting you through it. A couple of other people working out with them (girl and guy). All the exercises are functional, core-involved, and challenging. You will need some dumbbells to make it challenging. Unless you can use something else to work with. All in all, a good workout. It will be a good mix with the rest of my exercise dvds.
Title: N/A
